Benchmark.title: Supply Chain Risk Management (SCRM) - Product Security Assessment Checklist
Benchmark.description: This is a checklist for doing surface-level security assessments of a product for supply chain security, particularly an IT product. This is intended to use publicly available resources and will be updated with new resources as they are discovered

Rule.title: Product Name
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>What is the product name? Include specifics such as the model number, service tag or product ID such that the item can be ordered with the same identifier and the exact same product will be deliered.</VulnDiscussion>

Rule.title: Product Type
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>What is the product type? Select from [Hardware, Software, Firmware, Service]. If the purchased product is hardware that comes with software, select hardware. A separate risk assessment will need to be done for software unless it is immutable to the hardware.</VulnDiscussion>

Rule.title: Product Description
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>Describe the product, its general type and purpose with special consideration for security concerns.</VulnDiscussion>

Rule.title: Product Author/Manufacturer
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>Who is the producer of this product? If there has been a security assessment done of the producer, list the unique ID of that assessment and/or of the business.</VulnDiscussion>

Rule.title: CHESS Product ID
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>If the product is available in CHESS, what is the product ID in the supplier's catalogue for that contract?</VulnDiscussion>

Rule.title: CHESS Product SONA
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>If the product is not available in CHESS, has a SONA been procured? List a location (PoC, file path or URL) where the SONA can be found.</VulnDiscussion>

Rule.title: License Type
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>What type of license does this product use? - If there is no license associated, list "none, one-time purchase". - If it is a perpetual license, list "Perpetual License". - If it is an open source license, list the license type and version (MIT, GNU, etc.). - If it is a proprietary license, list it as such and provide a URL or further info to look up the license details.</VulnDiscussion>

Rule.title: TAA Compliance
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>Does this product comply with FAR 52.225-5 reuqiring products to be manufactured in TAA signatory countries? (https://www.acquisition.gov/far/52.225-5) Put another way, is this product manufactured (or can it be manufactured upon request) in a TAA signatory country?</VulnDiscussion>

Rule.title: DISA Approved Products List
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>Is this product on the DISA Enterprise Network Approved Products List (APL)? https://aplits.disa.mil/processAPList.action This site requires a CAC card to access. </VulnDiscussion>

Rule.title: NIAP/CommonCritieria Approval
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>Is the product NIAP / Common Criteria approved? NIAP: Product Compliant List (niap-ccevs.org)</VulnDiscussion>

Rule.title: Wireless Capabilities
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>Does this technology have wireless capability? (describe if so)</VulnDiscussion>

Rule.title: Data-At-Rest Encryption
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>Does this technology have data at rest encryption capability? (describe if so)</VulnDiscussion>

Rule.title: Data-In-Transit Encryption
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>Does this technology have data-in-transit encryption capability? (describe if so)</VulnDiscussion>

Rule.title: Hardware Ports
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>Does the device have hardware ports, if HW? (describe each if so)</VulnDiscussion>

Rule.title: Data Type
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>What kind of data will this technology process in its intended use?</VulnDiscussion>

Rule.title: TEMPEST Certified
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>Is this technology TEMPEST certified? If so, obtain a copy of the certificate and list where it can be found.</VulnDiscussion>

Rule.title: Environment
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>What kind of environment is this product to be deployed in? How and where will it be implemented?</VulnDiscussion>

Rule.title: Tech Specs
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>What capabilities or functions does this technology have? (tech specs, user guide or other functionality brief from vendor attached here will suffice)</VulnDiscussion>

Rule.title: CVEs on NVD
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>List any outstanding vulnerabilities against this product from the NVD and IAVMs from DISA. List the CPE(s) from NVD (if available) that will assist in identifying future vulnerabilities.</VulnDiscussion>

Rule.title: Applicable STIG or SRG
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>STIG or SRG applicable to this technology?</VulnDiscussion>

Rule.title: Vulnerability Scan
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>Results of a vulnerability scan against technology?</VulnDiscussion>

Rule.title: Updates and Patches
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>How often are updates/patches published for the product?</VulnDiscussion>

Rule.title: Overall Risks
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>List the overall risks identified in the use of this product, as well as any recommendations for deploying it securely if applicable.</VulnDiscussion>

Rule.title: MITRE ATTaCK Model
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>Complete a model of the product against the MITRE ATTaCK Framework indicating any attack vectors applicable to the product, and provide it here, either as the location to an external file/resource or pasted in as JSON. https://mitre-attack.github.io/attack-navigator/</VulnDiscussion>

Rule.title: MITRE D3FEND Model
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>Complete a model of the product against the MITRE D3FEND Framework indicating any defensive measures in place in the product, and provide it here, either as the location to an external file/resource or pasted in as JSON. https://d3fend.mitre.org/>

Rule.title: MITRE System of Trust
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>Complete a model of the product against the MITRE System of Trust Framework as a complete SCRM assessment for the product, and provide it here, either as the location to an external file/resource or pasted in as JSON. https://sot.mitre.org/ As of this revision, the MITRE SoT and its associated Body of Knowledge are under development and haven't been completely released yet. The website does provide ways to be notified of updates and to register for initial access.>

Rule.title: NIST Asset ID Model
Rule.description: <VulnDiscussion>Complete a model of the product using NIST's SCAP Asset Identification schema, and provide it here, either as the location to an external file/resource or pasted in as JSON. https://csrc.nist.gov/Projects/Security-Content-Automation-Protocol/Specifications/aid>
